column4: Ford to offer F-150 pick-up that can run on compressed natural gas
column5: By Deepa Seetharaman     DETROIT  July 31 Ford Motor Co  the second-largest U.S. automaker  will offer this fall an F-150 pickup truck that can run on compressed natural gas to take advantage of the resurgence in truck demand.     The move also allows Ford to capture consumers' interest  as rivals General Motors Co and Fiat SpA's Chrysler Group LLC sell revamped versions of their trucks to U.S. car shoppers. Ford is expected to introduce its overhauled truck next year.      U.S. dema

column4: Phillips 66 adjusting NJ crude slates due to Bakken cost rise
column5: HOUSTON  July 31 U.S. independent refiner and chemical company Phillips 66 has increased runs of light crude imports at its New Jersey refinery as costs of North Dakota Bakken crude increased in recent weeks  executives told analysts on Wednesday.

column4: Phillips 66 profit falls on higher crude costs
column5: U.S. refiner Phillips 66  reported a quarterly profit below analysts' estimates due to higher costs for some of the U.S. crude oil it processes  sending its shares down 3 percent before the bell.

column4: Phillips 66 quarterly profit lower
column5: July 31 U.S. refining company Phillips 66  on Wednesday reported a lower second-quarter profit  as the cost of some of the domestic crude oil it processes rose.

column4: Northrop beats out Raytheon for F-16 radar upgrade deal
column5: WASHINGTON Northrop Grumman Corp  on Wednesday said it had been chosen by Lockheed Martin Corp  to upgrade the radar systems on F-16 fighter jets for the U.S. Air Force and Taiwan  a deal that could pave the way for more foreign orders in coming years.

column4: China Molybdenum shares open up 5.1 pct after Rio Tinto deal
column5: HONG KONG  July 31 Shares of China Molybdenum Co Ltd rose 5.1 percent on Wednesday as its Hong Kong-listed stock resumed trade after Australian regulators cleared its purchase of a majority stake in the Northparkes copper mine from Rio Tinto.

column4: RBS in talks with regulators to appoint McEwan as new CEO: FT
column5: RBS  is in late-stage talks with regulators at the Bank of England to appoint Ross McEwan as its new chief executive  replacing Stephen Hester who stepped down last month  the Financial Times reported.

column4: Presidents Cup must adopt Ryder points: Price
column5: AKRON  Ohio For the biennial Presidents Cup to survive  it requires an overhaul of its points system to make it more closely contested and should adopt the structure used by the Ryder Cup  says International captain Nick Price.

column4: FDA panel recommends over-the-counter use of Sanofi allergy drug
column5: WASHINGTON Sanofi SA's allergy drug Nasacort AQ is safe enough to be used without a prescription  a panel of advisors to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration ruled on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Sony expected to reject entertainment spin-off - Nikkei
column5: July 31 Sony Corp's board is expected to reject a proposal from activist investor Daniel Loeb  whose fund is the company's largest shareholder  to spin-off part of its entertainment division  the Nikkei newspaper reported.

column4: Target's new baby section takes aim at specialty shops' service
column5: Target Corp is testing a baby section with trained staff at 10 Illinois stores in a push to gain a bigger share of the shrinking but highly competitive market for baby gear.

column4: Italy police search offices  home of Telecom Italia director -source
column5: ROME  July 31 Italian financial police searched the offices and home of Telecom Italia board member Elio Catania on Wednesday as part of an investigation into possible insider trading  a source familiar with the probe told Reuters.

column4: Brazil's TIM holds three-year outlook despite slowdown
column5: SAO PAULO  July 31 TIM Participaçoes SA   Brazil's second-largest wireless phone company  stands by its three-year performance forecasts despite a fragile economic outlook that has chilled consumer sentiment  Chief Executive Rodrigo Abreu told analysts on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Brazil's TIM beats second-quarter profit forecasts
column5: SAO PAULO  July 31 TIM Participaçoes SA   Brazil's second-largest wireless phone company  posted a 12 percent rise in second-quarter profit  beating forecasts on strong cost controls.

column4: TIM Brasil beats second-quarter profit forecasts
column5: SAO PAULO  July 31 TIM Participaçoes SA   Brazil's second-largest wireless phone company  posted a 12 percent rise in second-quarter net income from a year earlier to 386 million reais ($170 million)  according to a late Monday securities filing.

column4: Trinity Industries beats second-quarter estimates
column5: LOS ANGELES Trinity Industries Inc  on Wednesday posted second-quarter earnings that surpassed estimates  and the company raised its outlook  thanks to thriving demand for its tank cars used to ship crude oil by rail.

column5: WASHINGTON A U.S. judge has sided with retailers seeking a lower cap on fees charged by banks for debit card transactions in a key ruling that dragged down the shares of card companies Visa Inc and MasterCard Inc.

column4: Weatherford retreats from full-service oilfield battle
column5: July 31 Weatherford International Ltd  has abandoned its  ambitions to sell a wide variety of services across the oilfield spectrum  and is instead sharpening its focus on what makes the most money.

column4: World Fuel doubts Quebec rail-crash payment order is legal
column5: U.S. fuel logistics company World Fuel Services Corp said on Tuesday it has "serious objections" to being ordered by the Quebec government to help pay for the cleanup of the devastating railway crash in Lac-Megantic  Quebec  on July 6.

column4: Yelp loss narrows as mobile advertising grows
column5: Consumer reviews website Yelp Inc  posted a smaller-than-expected quarterly loss  helped by a stronger mobile advertising business  and it forecast third-quarter revenue above analysts' expectations.
